alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fergus County through 245 PM MDT... At 214 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Lewistown, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grass Range, Roy, Fergus, Forestgrove, Giltedge, Hilger and Heath. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 86 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 6 and 42, and between mile markers 39 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In addition, frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for central Montana.
